meanings.definition: Acrylamides: Chemical compounds formed during the cooking process of certain foods.
meanings.sent1: The acrylamides in the fried potatoes were created when they were cooked at high temperatures.
meanings.sent2: It is important to be aware of the acrylamides that can develop in foods like potato chips when they are fried.
meanings.sent3: The acrylamides in the burnt toast decided to throw a party and turn the kitchen into a disco.
meanings.sent4: The acrylamides in the oven danced around like tiny chemical wizards casting spells on the food.
meanings.sent5: The acrylamides in the pan sizzled and popped, releasing their magical aroma into the air.

meanings.definition: Acrylamides: Substances that can potentially be harmful to human health when consumed in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: Eating too many foods with acrylamides may not be good for your health in the long run.
meanings.sent2: Health experts advise limiting the intake of acrylamides to reduce potential risks.
meanings.sent3: The acrylamides in the cookies whispered to each other, plotting mischief in the stomach.
meanings.sent4: The acrylamides in the soup swirled ominously, like tiny villains waiting to strike.
meanings.sent5: The acrylamides in the snack bar lurked in the shadows, ready to cause trouble if eaten in excess.
